title: Open Policy Alliance Welcomes the Open Source Technology Improvement Fund as New Member
content:
The Open Source Initiative (OSI) is pleased to welcome the Open Source Technology Improvement Fund (OSTIF) to the Open Policy Alliance. OSTIF is a nonprofit dedicated to securing Open Source apps.
The post Open Policy Alliance Welcomes the Open Source Technology Improvement Fund as New Member appeared first on Open Source Initiative.
creator: Katie Steen-James
sourceDescription: The steward of the Open Source Definition, setting the foundation for the Open Source Software ecosystem.

title: Open Source Without Borders: Reflections from COSCon’25
content:

title: DPGA’s Annual Members Meeting: Advancing Open Source & DPGs for the Public Good
content:
The DPGA’s Annual Members Meeting highlighted several priorities that resonate strongly with OSI’s mission, including promoting Open Source software, advancing public-interest AI, and strengthening global collaboration.
The post DPGA’s Annual Members Meeting: Advancing Open Source & DPGs for the Public Good appeared first on Open Source Initiative.

title: Patents and Open Source: Understanding the Risks and Available Solutions
content:
The Open Source community has spent two decades building the scaffolding to make patent threats rare and containable. Developers who understand that landscape can focus on what they do best: innovating in the open, confident that the legal ground beneath them is far more stable than any patent myths suggest.
The post Patents and Open Source: Understanding the Risks and Available Solutions appeared
creator: McCoy Smith
sourceDescription: The steward of the Open Source Definition, setting the foundation for the Open Source Software ecosystem.

title: OFA Symposium 2025 and the Launch of the Open Technology Research Network (OTRN)
content:
The OpenForum Academy Symposium 2025 organized by OpenForum Europe (OFE) brought together researchers, policymakers, practitioners, and open technology leaders for two days of deep inquiry into how open technologies shape our economies, infrastructures, and societies.
The post OFA Symposium 2025 and the Launch of the Open Technology Research Network (OTRN) appeared first on Open Source Initiative.
creator: Nick Vidal
sourceDescription: The steward of the Open Source Definition, setting the foundation for the Open Source Software ecosystem.

title: Open Source: A global commons to enable digital sovereignty
content: In a world increasingly run by software, countries around the world are waking up to their dependency on foreign services and products. Geopolitical shifts drive digital sovereignty to the top of the political agenda in Europe and other regions. How can we ensure that regulations protecting our citizens actually apply? How do we guarantee continuity of operations in a potentially fragmenting world
creator: Thierry Carrez
sourceDescription: The steward of the Open Source Definition, setting the foundation for the Open Source Software ecosystem.
